comments.body: I debated support this via respecting `WHAT`, but that conflicts with (theoretical) current usage like `make quick-release-images all WHAT=...`. I doubt anyone is doing that though, and doing it that way has no performance wins versus distinct calls (because most of what happens is in recursive make here, not the top level call)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@# include extra WHAT if specified so you can build docker images + binaries
# in one call with a single pass of syncing to the container + generating code
if [[ -n "${KUBE_EXTRA_WHAT:-}" ]]; then
    CMD_TARGETS="${CMD_TARGETS} ${KUBE_EXTRA_WHAT}"
fi

comments.body: how did the 1.17 release build without this? cmd/kubelet isn't in KUBE_CONFORMANCE_IMAGE_TARGETS
we use `make release` a slightly different code path: https://cs.k8s.io/?q=make.*release&i=nope&files=&repos=kubernetes/release
is it a problem if cmd/kubectl is included in the list twice? it is also in KUBE_CONFORMANCE_IMAGE_TARGETS

@liggitt tried both `KUBE_BUILD_CONFORMANCE=y` and `KUBE_BUILD_CONFORMANCE=n` the double invocation is harmless, i wanted to contain the change into a single line that we can remove later. can split it up if you wish. this target is developer convenience only.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +32,36 @@
# TODO(dims): Remove this when we get rid of hyperkube image
CMD_TARGETS="${CMD_TARGETS} cmd/kubelet cmd/kubectl"

kube::build::verify_prereqs
